instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Test MCP
threads.message: Hello I would like to know if there is a good method of testing the functioning of the MCP

threads.title: Test MCP
threads.message:
If you reffer to MCP79/89, be aware that you cannot expect too much from such chips, with more than 10 yo.
Measuring the resistance to ground on 3V42_G3H is a good method; use ohm scale, not diode mode.
A value lower than 30K, usually means bad MCP...

threads.title: Test MCP
threads.message: Could you describe to me the method or reference points for making the measure? I’m a beginner

threads.title: Test MCP
threads.message:
Taking as refference 820-2879 board, L6995 is the easiest point to access for test.
You can choose any other point connected to 3V42_G3H power rail.

Read more here...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/there-is-a-way-to-test-apple-chipset-before-using-them.38304/#post-38341[/URL]
